availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jacob Doudel Yeiser (Eddyville, Kentucky, druggist and physician)

body.p: Eddyville, Kentucky, druggist and physician. Kentucky native. Married to Mary V. Craig Yeiser. Father of Alma B. Yeiser, Edwin R. Yeiser, Charles C. Yeiser, and Cornelia Yeiser. Graduated from the Medical Department of the University of Louisville in 1861. Farmer in Boyle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Druggist in Eddyville in 1860. Physician in Lyon County, Kentucky, in 1863.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District 2, p. 367; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 762; U.S., School Catalogs, 1765-1935, Ancestry, University of Louisville, 1861, p. 27; U.S. IRS Tax Assessment Lists, 1862-1918, Ancestry, Kentucky, 1863, Collection District 1, Division 20, p. 7; Find A Grave, "Dr. Jacob Doudel Yeiser (1822-1908)," Memorial #105280392, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=105280392 (accessed August 21, 2017).
